result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Clerk:  Amy. 
Case called: 9:03 a.m.   
INCLUDES 22CF140, 22CF141, 22CF142
State appears by ADA Jonathan Barnett. Defendant appears in person with Atty Thomas Roley.  

Date and time set for preliminary hearing; VRCW. 
Atty Roley states defendant has requested him to withdraw as counsel and wants to go to SPD office. 
Defendant makes statement.  
Atty Roley waives time limits on all cases. 
COURT grants waiver of time limits.  

COURT questions Atty Roley re: withdraw request; Atty Roley is prepared to proceed with prelim. 
COURT makes findings and denies defendant's request to have Atty Roley withdraw.   
Defendant makes objections and wishes to fire his Atty Roley; COURT grants and removes Atty Roley on all 3 matters based on findings. 

COURT sets RH 2/18/22 at 1:00 p.m. with Court Commissioner.  

Adj:  9:11 a.m.

INCLUDES 22CF140, 22CF141, 22CF142.  No contact with victim(s):  CDH, AAH or CX.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.    Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.    No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.    Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.    Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.

COURT ORDERS: $3000 cash bond to cover all 3 files - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): CDH, AAH, or CX. 
- No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening. 
- Prints & Photograph.
